item.title: Far-right rabbit hole on Youtube
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
14 minutes ago, Cykaaaa said:

Youtube does have an OBVIOUS agenda when it comes to the trending tab. It favours traditional media and late night shows, while often neglecting independent content creators.

Obviously.

This is not because big media is paying them. This is because YT wants to serves up more authoritative sources and smaller fringe independent creators are less trustworthy. YT can safely assume that CNN or MSNBC will not serve up racist content. YT cannot assume that about small creators who could be Neo-Nazis or the like. Even with PewDiePie vs Jimmy Fallon, YT can trust Jimmy Fallon a lot more than PewDiePie not to say some racist or false shit.

The bigger YT gets, the more mainstream it must be because mainstream is the only way to sustain the largest viewership numbers.

Google's search algorithm does the same thing with websites. Google heavily favors mainstream authoritative sources vs no-name indie blogs. Because mainstream sources can be trusted as having some kind of journalistic standards.

If Google did not do this, it's algorithm would quickly be gamed by spammers, hackers, and the scum of the internet.

Most normies have no clue how scummy the internet is. Google serves up a highly sanitize version of the internet after filtering out 90% of the scum.

Google's search algorithm literally has a list of the top 1000 sites that Google hand-selected as authoritative sources. And this list seeds the authority of the entire internet basically. Any links coming from those 1000 sources determine the authority of every webpage on the entire internet.

item.title: Someone justify the noself and out of body experience
item.description:
in Self-Actualization
On 7/11/2020 at 0:16 PM, Madhur said:

I am not enlightened, neither I had any OBE, but recently I am trying to do astral travel. But....

in his enlightenment video leo said that you are nothingness aka pure transparent awareness, so I can't wrap my mind around that if there is no self then how this experiences is possible, what is actually getting out of our body if there is noself ? this thing is keep bugging me whenever I try to achieve OBE.Â 

Please enlighten me on this topic, thanks! ðŸ’™

Nothingness is imagining everything. Just like how a white sheet of paper holds whatever is drawn on it.

You can have all sorts of mystical experiences of aliens, out of body, astral realms, chakras, etc.

But all of it is happening within Nothingness. All of it is Nothingness.

No-self is a higher degree of consciousness than an OBE or a formed mystical experience.

The highest realization is that you have no form whatsoever. There is no reason to get out of your body because you were never in your body to begin with. You are omnipresent. You cannot go anywhere because you are already everywhere and everywhere is nowhere and nothing.

item.title: What Do You Think Of Feminism?
item.description:
in Dating, Relationships, Sexuality
55 minutes ago, w4read said:

Feminism, pick up, socialism, conservativism, MRAs, right extremists... At some point you gottaÂ ask yourself what's the point of using all these terms though, when there are so huge diversity in how these words are used and perceived. Like, if I tell a crowd of 20 people thatÂ I'm a "feminist" or that IÂ doÂ "pick up ", and those 20 people have totally different definitions/views on those terms, wouldn't it then be better if I said " I'm a huge believer of equal rights and I feel like we still have a long way to go" or " I really enjoy approaching girls and getting to share my authentic self and by thatÂ givingÂ both her and my self a pleasant experience which could potentially lead to something more"? It would obviously make the communication more clear at least.

Congrats! You've discovered the trade-off between brevity and clarity.

"I'm a huge believer of equal rights and I feel like we still have a long way to go" << even if you said that every time instead of "feminism" you'd still be stuck with a lack of clarity. Now you'd have to define "equal rights" and "a long way to go".

In fact, you in order to get full clarity you would have to define every single term in your entire worldview/mind. But you'd be dead before then. And still, people would misunderstand you because they lack your reference experiences used to define the terms.

The mind is a slippery beast. Which is why this stuff gets argued about for ages without resolution.

item.title: Far-right rabbit hole on Youtube
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
7 minutes ago, Apparition of Jack said:

@Leo GuraÂ  Kind of tangentially related, but do you think there's an argument for some sort of public oversight or investment into the running of YouTube? At this point it's basically become the default method of information exchange for so many millions of people that the corporation has become incredibly powerful in terms of controlling what people's eyeballs see. I mean I guess they're doing a good enough job as it is, but at the same time some sort of regulations could ensure that it doesn't abuse its power for one malicious end or another?

Yes, of course all massively popular social media platforms need government regulation and oversight.

The feds could set up an "online media court" which handles cases like that of YT vs Stefan Molyneux or Alex Jones, where an impartial and well-educated panel of judges adjudicates whether community guidelines were violated or not, and the whole thing can be aired live on YT for all citizens to see. This would be a huge win for liberal democracy, free speech, and civil rights.

It's okay to ban people as long as the process of getting banned is fair and transparent, and the person has an ability to defend himself against strawman arguments or being taken out of context.

item.title: How to project more empathy?
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

A powerful technique they teach life coaches is called Validation. It works like this:

Whenever a client introduces some new problem or challenge he's facing, you as the coach hear it out and say:

Coach: "How does that make you feel?"

Client: Explains feelings

Coach: "How do you REALLY feel about?"

Client: Explains even deeper feelings

Coach: "I hear you say you really feel X because of Y. It's valid to feel that way because..."

All identity is relative, subjective, and self-constructed.

Whatever you think you are, you're imagining that. Whether you think you're a human, a 30 year old male, or whatever.

The reason you feel some of these identities are more real and less constructed is because society happens to reinforce your imaginary identity.

So, for example, if you were born into a society/culture which believed that all humans are aliens, you would identify as an alien and you would feel that this is your true biological identity.

Your actual identity is Nothing. Which allows you to pretend to be whoever you want. But the added wrinkle is... since you are addicted to the approval and authority of your culture, you only tend to take seriously those identities which your culture says are valid and real. So when some college kid tells you that she's a unicorn, you think that's stupid. Because your culture tells you that people cannot be unicorns.

Who is right? No one. It's all relative.

item.title: China Will NEVER Outpace The US
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
22 hours ago, Scholar said:

One of the problems of being the first and most advanced society is that one is also susceptable to running into mistakes no one ever ran into before. In the dark it is always the fastest runner who will run off the cliff. The very things that made the US special might now become it's downfall.

This is a good point. Unfortunately it is undermined by the fact that Norther European countries are slightly more developed than the US already. So the problems the US is facing in transitioning to stage Green is not new, it is a known pattern. So it's the US is not as novel at it seems.

Quote

The deconstruction of a unifying narrative (for example religion and nationalism) whilst allowing the corrupted capitalistic institutions to fill that power-vacuum (to determine the narrative and control information flow) turned out to be a really terrible idea, which only now has been revealed as such.

It's not so terrible. It's still better than what came before.

Quote

Noone previously made this mistake, because the United States are the first who reached this point. And at this point it isn't even just self-sabotage, but also other entities that contribute to the division and deconstruction of a unifying narrative.

Europe is more secular than the US. They seem to be handling it okay. They are also less commericialized and materialistic. Less excessive Orange.

Quote

Unless people imagine it, unless they delude themselves that there is. Structured society requires a story, because the story is what makes the structure arise. You can't have a structured society if everyone can choose their own story, atleast not at this stage of development. Because at this stage of development anyone with enough money can create a story. And because you have such a competitive landscape you will get competing forces instead of unifying forces.

Stage Green is unifies society around a shared universal common humanity.

In the end we all unified under Love. Love is not some fake story. Love is the bedrock of consciousness. So we don't need to bullshit ourselves with nationalist, racist, or fascist mythology. We can unify under a common consciousness of Love.

Quote

Notice that if China recognized that it was important to fight climate change, they could immediately restructure their entire economy. They could within a decade transform themselves.

The United States? You can't do this. There are so many powers at play that it is virtually impossible to mobilize consistent action towards a certain goal.

These are the trade-offs between being more authoritarian vs democratic. But China pays a heavy cost for their rapid mobilization ability. It's dictatorial and tramples many civil rights.

20 minutes ago, Wasem said:

When the USA has enabled people like yourself to teach freely, reach higher state of consciousness , you should trust how fucking unique this is. You know it but you should trust it more. There's no other nation that's build on so many layers of breakthroughs that could enable the same circumstances that allowed you to reach to what you are today.

Yes, of course. And now we're talking about how to help the US reach the next level of evolution.

What got us here will not be enough to get us to the next stage. We need a paradigm shift. Unfortunately conservatives see this paradigm shift as crazy, evil, and unAmerican. It's exactly the same thing as what happened with Galileo and the Catholic church. They were fearful of his new paradigm even though it was the obvious way forward.

item.title: Libertarian Examples Mega-Thread
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
13 minutes ago, Parththakkar12 said:

Interesting idea. I don't know of many lower-ranked employees who would like to share the loss margins if the higher-ups mess up though. Would this require them to invest in the stocks of their company too?

It will take immense levels of trust between people. It could work. I'd say it's worth a shot.

I think the most you'd stand to lose is your share of future profits and your job.

The low level employees would not invest their own money. They would be given the share of ex-employees who left the company.

Basically the company would constantly be reallocating shares based on who's working, how much work they do, and how valuable their work is. If you leave the company, you lose all your shares. If the company makes no profit, you gain no bonus, but you still get a base salary. If the company goes bankrupt you lose your job and your shares.

Basically the point is to make sure that no one who isn't working in the company can buy shares. Only workers should be allowed to have a share of the profits, not outside speculators or Wall Street wolves.

The billion dollar question I have is this: is it possible to entirely abolish Wall Street? Or does Wall Street actually serve a necessary role? Could we construct a society and economy in which Wall Street's role would be made completely obsolete? I'm not sure, but it's a question worth seriously exploring.

Of course it should be obvious now why the people in power absolutely HATE this idea and will do everything in their power not to even consider it as a possibility. Those in power primarily thrive off the labor of others, yet they MUST deny this in their own minds.

item.title: Libertarian Examples Mega-Thread
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

I think it could work the way pirate ships worked. The pirate ship was basically a co-op model. But it wasn't flat. It had hierarchy and strong leadership, but every pirate, even the greenhorn, would get a percentage share of all the loot.

So, the captain might get 1/3 share.

His lieutenants might get 1/15th share.

And the lowest greenhorn sailor might get 1/100th share.

As you rise up the ranks and gain more experience and responsibility, your share increases.

This all basically boils down to how ownership and spoils get distributed.

The federal gov could basically mandate that each corporation with over 10, 50, or 100 employees must adopt this share model or face heavy fines/taxes.

in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

Careful though about framing this as the good guys vs the enemy. The problem is thatÂ Vaush is polarizing his listeners too much, making them see the right-wing as "the enemy". This will make it impossible to govern half the country.

Of course most right-wingers are not consciously, intentionally fascist. But their ideology makes it easy for them to become soft supports of fascist leaders. Trump has a 90% approval rating in his own party, which is a very troubling sign. So while most right wingers willÂ never explicitly say they support fascism, many of them can be fooled into voting a fascist into office because they have nationalist sympathies and the culture wars can be used to trick them into voting for those who will own those scary crazy Libs.Â 

Fascists love to pander to and stoke up the natural ethnocentric fearsÂ that roughly half of any given country has. Propaganda channels like Fox News will stroke up these fears to the point where otherwise moderate folks become confused and start acting to defend against those fears.

item.title: Vaush on Fascism
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics

So I've been listening a lot to Vaush over the last week and although he is overly edgy and overly stuck in Green, he's got some pretty astute and brilliant insight into certain aspects of politics.

I found the following video particularly insightful:

Vaush is making me think more deeply about what fascism really entails and how sneaky it is. And while I still think he over-uses that term, I'm also starting to see an undeniable slippery slope between right-wing populism and fascism.

Is there really such as thing as right-wing populism which will not devolve into xenophobia, racism, and authoritarianism? I'd like to think so, but I'm not as certain of that as I used to be. These new right-wing populists can be very sneaky with their messaging. After all, if someone was a true populist why wouldn't he support someone like Bernie or AOC? Right-wing populists are nationalists first and populists second. Otherwise they'd be left-wing populists.

Anyways... just some food for thought.

If you overlook Vaush's excessive edginess and hyperbole, he has some of the most sophisticated political analysis I've seen on YT.

I find high doses of DMT downright terrifying. It's too much consciousness for a human to handle.

item.title: Pick Up Material Mega-Thread
item.description:
in Dating, Relationships, Sexuality

Here's a good list of tips for you newbies:

https://www.reddit.com/r/seduction/comments/hmfdu7/the_most_common_mistakes_guys_make_in_the_field/

Sometimes the best pickup advice you will find written as simple online posts by anonymous guys who clearly hit the field. There's tons of this stuff available online.

Look for guys who sound like they spend a lot of time in the field, and take notes on their tips and top lessons. Then follow those as you hit the field yourself. That's basically how you learn game in a nutshell. It's not very fancy or complicated. You just need to figure out the top 20 or 30 principles and practice them religiously.

One of the most valuable parts of RSD was their forum, with Field Reports and advanced practitioners posting their highest lessons and tips. That alone was enough to learn game. Too bad it's all gone now. But you can find other online sources.

item.title: There is no correct ideology, is there
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
49 minutes ago, Gesundheit said:

@Leo Gura But Leo how would you objectively measure the levels of consciousness of your candidates? I assume when we vote we subconsciously automatically choose the most conscious from our perspective. I would always choose the most conscious candidate from my pov and I assume everyone else would do the same from their povs. But how could we get to agree to have a similar pov? Aren't difference and relativity inherent in reality? If we were already in agreement, then wouldn't the whole political system collapse cause it would be useless? Doesn't politics exists mainly to unite our differences?

It's pretty easy to see who is more conscious if you are doing consciousness work.

Or just rely on Spiral Dynamics as a rough guide.

Of course most people will be biased in favor of their fave candidate.
